thegame.onScreenObjects

Class Slider

  • java.lang.Object
    • thegame.onScreenObjects.Slider

  • public class Slider
extends java.lang.Object
    A slider UI component that allows users to select a value within a range. Used primarily in the SettingsScreen for adjusting volume and other settings.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Slider(float x, float y, float width, float height, float initialValue)
      Creates a new slider with the specified position, size, and initial value.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Gets the height of the slider.

      Gets the current value of the slider.

      Gets the width of the slider.
      float getX()
      Gets the x-coordinate of the slider.
      float getY()
      Gets the y-coordinate of the slider.
      boolean handleMouseClick(float mouseX, float mouseY)
      Handles mouse clicks on the slider.
      boolean handleMouseClick(float mouseX, float mouseY, float scaleX, float scaleY)
      Handles mouse clicks on the slider with scaling support.
      void handleMouseMove(double mouseX, double mouseY, float scaleX, float scaleY)
      Handles mouse movement when dragging the slider.
      void handleMouseRelease(double mouseX, double mouseY)
      Handles mouse release to stop dragging.
      boolean isDragging()
      Checks if the slider is currently being dragged.
      void render(float mouseX, float mouseY)
      Renders the slider at its current position and with its current value.

      Renders the slider with scaling support for different screen resolutions.
      void setColors(float r, float g, float b)
      Sets the colors for the slider, allowing for customization of its appearance.

      Sets the value of the slider.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Slider

        public Slider(float x,
              float y,
              float width,
              float height,
              float initialValue)
        Creates a new slider with the specified position, size, and initial value.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the slider
        y - The y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the slider
        width - The width of the slider
        height - The height of the slider
        initialValue - The initial value of the slider (between 0 and 1)

    • Method Detail

      • setColors

        public void setColors(float r,
                      float g,
                      float b)
        Sets the colors for the slider, allowing for customization of its appearance.
        Parameters:
        r - The red component of the slider's fill color (0-1)
        g - The green component of the slider's fill color (0-1)
        b - The blue component of the slider's fill color (0-1)

      • render

        public void render(float mouseX,
                   float mouseY)
        Renders the slider at its current position and with its current value.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - The current mouse x-coordinate
        mouseY - The current mouse y-coordinate

      • render

        public void render(float mouseX,
                   float mouseY,
                   float scaleX,
                   float scaleY)
        Renders the slider with scaling support for different screen resolutions.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - The current mouse x-coordinate
        mouseY - The current mouse y-coordinate
        scaleX - The horizontal scale factor
        scaleY - The vertical scale factor

      • handleMouseClick

        public boolean handleMouseClick(float mouseX,
                                float mouseY)
        Handles mouse clicks on the slider.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - The mouse x-coordinate
        mouseY - The mouse y-coordinate
        Returns:
        true if the slider was clicked, false otherwise

      • handleMouseClick

        public boolean handleMouseClick(float mouseX,
                                float mouseY,
                                float scaleX,
                                float scaleY)
        Handles mouse clicks on the slider with scaling support.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - The mouse x-coordinate
        mouseY - The mouse y-coordinate
        scaleX - The horizontal scale factor
        scaleY - The vertical scale factor
        Returns:
        true if the slider was clicked, false otherwise

      • handleMouseMove

        mouseY - The mouse y-coordinate

        scaleY - The vertical scale factor

      • getValue

        public float getValue()
        Gets the current value of the slider.
        Returns:
        The current value (between 0 and 1)

      • setValue

        public void setValue(float value)
        Sets the value of the slider.
        Parameters:
        value - The new value (will be clamped between 0 and 1)
